title: Adding .com default for Firefox 108.0.1
content:
With previous versions of Firefox (before 108.0.1) I was able to make changes with about:config to allow a default domain id .com to be added to my Internet query. Example I enter cnn and would get cnn.com and assess the website. WIth 108.0.1 I enter cnn and Firefox cannot find the site. The about:config changes I made are: 

 set browser.urlbar.autofill to false, set keyword.enabled to false and set browser.fixup.alternate.enabled to true.

The changes are mentioned in the incident https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1142103.

With 108.0.1 how can this be implemented like in the past versions? Thanks

title: Video Playback Is Slow To Start or Won't Start At All
content:
Recently anytime I've tried watching videos on Youtube or Twitter on my desktop PC I've been having issues. On Youtube, It takes about 5 seconds to start a video (including ads), 5 seconds to load up a place I skipped to in the video even if it's loaded, and if I go to the start of the video sometimes it won't even try playing. On Twitter, videos are hit or miss, most won't play, and others will autoplay but will stop working if you pause or skip. Tumblr and TikTok work fine.

I've tried running a private tab (disabling extensions) and still have issues, I've tried turning off hardware acceleration, clearing data, and even reinstalling Firefox. I tried both Twitter and Youtube on Chrome and video playback worked just as well as Firefox used to. I also updated my video card driver to see if it'd help without luck. I have great internet that I haven't had recent issues with either to cause loading problems.

I hope to find a solution soon, I haven't found anyone else sharing this issue yet, but that I've found, it's Firefox. If there's any additional information that'd be helpful that I can get I can try getting it.
creator: brando9g

title: Firefox fiók belépési 6 jegyű kód hiánya
content:
Tisztelt Cím! Szeretnék segítséget kapni abban, hogy a Firefox felületén szeretnék bejelentkezni, hogy más eszközeimmel szinkronban legyek. Több email címem is van, de nekem egy cím belépésére és szinkronizálására volna szükségem. Ezzel a gmail-es címmel M.Edge valamint a Chrome-ban sikeresen betudtam lépni, egyedül a Firefox felületén nem. Mivel sokat tesztelek különböző internetes keresőkben, ezért a Firefox elérésében is szükségem lenne. Ezzel a címmel (többinél megkapom a 6 jegyű kódot, vagy megerősítési lehetőséget) soha nem kapok semmilyen értesítőt sem a mobilomra, se a levelező rendszerembe. Levelezőrendszerben a Spam-től kezdve minden részt megtekintek (mobilon is) és nem találok belépéshez szükséges 6 jegyű kódot. Ez az email cím: gaalne.anita@gmail.com lenne és az ehhez kapcsolódó beállított telefonszám: 30/9050410

Kérem segítsenek, mert szükségem lenne a munkámhoz, valamint ezt a keresőt szeretem a legjobban.

Segítségüket előre is köszönöm.

title: Firefox 108.0.1 now sorts Window-menu items alphabetically, and I can't find anything
content:
I was forced to upgrade when FF crashed the other day, and now all of my windows are sorted alphabetically. This was exactly the behaviour that caused me to switch from Chrome to FF in the first place. I *HATE* having my windows sorted alphabetically. I have certain windows that remain open all the time, and they remain at the top of my Window menu drop-down, for easy access. (Hence, chronological by when the window opened, the old default behaviour.) Now, FF "helpfully" changes the window position every time I change tabs, and I can't find anything. I mentally sort windows by subject matter, not by the name displayed on the tab. I have tens of windows (20-30 typically) open at any given time. This makes it literally impossible to use the Window menu anymore, and I have to tab through open windows searching for what I need.

Mozilla, please make this a configurable option. It was really horrible of you to enforce this on us, just because some squeaky-wheels decided they preferred alphabetical sorting. They clearly are not power users, and this change has crippled those of us who are.
creator: dvinas

title: Number of tabs memory/cache
content:
Hi I'm wondering if anyone else has this problem. I've set it so that FF asks me if I want to close all tabs when I close a window or exit. This is to restore pages when I restart next. What I've noticed is, this number of tabs in the question only keeps increasing -for example, if I have 50 tabs open, close 10 of them during a browsing session and open 20 more, when I go to exit, it'll ask me if I want to close 80 tabs. And when I start up FF next time, that number 80 just keeps increasing when I open/close tabs. It doesn't seem to be refreshing the 'tab memory'. There needs to be a button perhaps that purges that tab cache and takes a fresh 'reading' of all current tabs open and updating the total number.

Anyone else experiencing this? Thanks
